companies.name: Renesas Electronics
companies.name_jp: ルネサスエレクトロニクス

profile_json.overview: Renesas Electronics is Japan's largest semiconductor company by revenue, specializing in microcontrollers (MCUs), analog & power devices, and SoCs for automotive, industrial, and IoT applications. The company has transformed through strategic M&A (Dialog, Intersil, IDT).
profile_json.thesis: Renesas is a structural winner in automotive semiconductor content growth driven by EV/ADAS adoption. The company's integrated analog+MCU+SoC portfolio creates sticky customer relationships. Margin expansion continues as the product mix shifts toward higher-value solutions.
key_assumptions: Automotive semiconductor content per vehicle continues to rise with EV/ADAS
Cross-selling synergies from Dialog/Intersil/IDT acquisitions fully materialize
Industrial IoT demand recovers from inventory correction in 2H2025
risk_factors: Automotive production slowdown impacting chip demand
Integration risks from multiple large acquisitions
Competition from NXP, Infineon, and TI in automotive MCU
profile_json.valuation_notes: Renesas trades at a discount to European auto semi peers (Infineon, NXP). Discount partly reflects Japan-listed discount but should narrow as profitability improves.

focus: Track automotive MCU order trends and design win pipeline
Monitor industrial/IoT inventory correction and recovery timing
Watch M&A integration progress and cross-selling metrics

profile_json.overview: Sony Group is a diversified conglomerate with leading positions in image sensors (CIS), gaming (PlayStation), music, pictures, and financial services. The semiconductor division (primarily CMOS image sensors) is the world's largest CIS supplier.
profile_json.thesis: Sony benefits from multiple structural growth vectors: AI-driven demand for advanced image sensors in smartphones and automotive, PlayStation platform ecosystem expansion, and recurring revenue growth in music/pictures streaming. The image sensor business is an underappreciated AI beneficiary.
key_assumptions: Image sensor demand grows with multi-camera smartphones and automotive ADAS
PlayStation Network subscriber base and ARPU continue to expand
Music streaming revenue growth sustains at high single digits
risk_factors: Smartphone market weakness impacting image sensor volumes
Gaming console cycle risk and competition from Xbox/Nintendo
Yen strength impacting overseas earnings translation

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: SOTP with sensor biz at 20x PE

profile_json.valuation_notes: Sony's conglomerate discount is unwarranted given best-in-class positions across gaming, sensors, and entertainment. Planned financial services spinoff could unlock value.

focus: Monitor image sensor order pipeline for smartphones and automotive
Track PlayStation Network subscriber growth and ARPU trends
Watch financial services spinoff progress and timeline

companies.name: Keyence
companies.sector: Factory Automation — Sensors, Vision Systems, Measurement

profile_json.overview: Keyence is a world-leading manufacturer of factory automation sensors, vision systems, barcode readers, and measurement equipment. The company operates a unique direct-sales model with industry-leading operating margins above 50%.
profile_json.thesis: Keyence is a structural beneficiary of factory automation investment globally, with AI/machine vision adoption accelerating demand. The direct-sales model creates unmatched customer intimacy and pricing power. Consistent 50%+ operating margins are best-in-class among global industrials.
key_assumptions: Global factory automation capex continues structural uptrend
AI-powered vision systems drive higher ASPs and new use cases
Direct-sales model sustains >50% operating margins
risk_factors: Cyclical slowdown in manufacturing capex globally
China macro weakness reducing factory automation demand
Yen volatility impacting overseas revenue translation

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 45x FY26E EPS on AI vision upcycle

profile_json.valuation_notes: Keyence commands a premium valuation justified by 55% operating margins and consistent earnings growth. AI vision adoption could drive the next leg of multiple expansion.

focus: Track global factory automation capex trends and order momentum
Monitor AI-powered vision system adoption and new product launches
Watch China manufacturing activity indicators for demand signals

profile_json.overview: Murata Manufacturing is the world's largest producer of multilayer ceramic capacitors (MLCCs) and a leading supplier of RF modules, piezoelectric sensors, and other electronic components. MLCCs are essential in every electronic device from smartphones to EVs.
profile_json.thesis: Murata benefits from rising MLCC content per device driven by 5G, EV, and AI server buildout. However, near-term inventory digestion in smartphone and PC markets creates headwinds. Long-term structural demand growth remains intact.
key_assumptions: MLCC content per device continues rising across automotive and AI servers
Smartphone market stabilizes and resumes modest growth
Automotive MLCC demand grows at double-digit rates
risk_factors: Prolonged smartphone/PC inventory correction
Chinese MLCC competitors gaining share in low-end segments
Automotive EV adoption pace slower than expected
profile_json.valuation_notes: Murata is fairly valued at current levels. Upside depends on timing of smartphone/PC recovery and automotive MLCC demand acceleration.

focus: Track MLCC pricing trends and inventory levels across channels
Monitor smartphone production volumes and component restocking
Watch automotive MLCC content growth and EV adoption rates

companies.name: TDK Corporation
companies.sector: Electronic Components — Passive Components, Batteries, Sensors

profile_json.overview: TDK is a leading electronic components manufacturer with a diverse portfolio including MLCCs, inductors, ferrite cores, lithium polymer batteries (via subsidiary ATL/TDK subsidiary), and MEMS sensors. The battery business is TDK's largest segment via its subsidiary supplying Apple and other smartphone OEMs.
profile_json.thesis: TDK's battery business provides stable growth tied to smartphone and wearable device volumes, while passive components benefit from automotive electrification. Valuation is undemanding but growth is modest. A potential catalyst is solid-state battery commercialization.
key_assumptions: Battery business maintains share in premium smartphone segment
Passive component demand recovers with automotive and industrial
Solid-state battery technology reaches commercial viability by 2027
risk_factors: Apple supply chain diversification reducing battery share
Chinese passive component competition in mid-range segments
Solid-state battery development delays

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 17x FY26E EPS on solid-state battery catalyst

valuation_scenarios.label: Bear
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 10x FY25E EPS on battery demand weakness

profile_json.valuation_notes: TDK is a value play in the electronic components space. Solid-state battery optionality is not priced in at current levels.

focus: Track battery order pipeline and Apple supply chain dynamics
Monitor solid-state battery development milestones and partnerships
Watch passive component inventory and pricing trends

profile_json.overview: Ibiden is a leading manufacturer of IC substrates (FC-BGA) and high-density printed circuit boards used in advanced semiconductors. The company is a critical supplier to Intel and other chipmakers for high-performance computing substrates.
profile_json.thesis: Ibiden is a key beneficiary of AI/HPC chip packaging complexity driving demand for advanced FC-BGA substrates. The substrate content per AI accelerator is significantly higher than traditional processors, creating a structural demand tailwind.
key_assumptions: AI accelerator demand drives FC-BGA substrate volume growth
Advanced packaging trends (chiplets, 2.5D/3D) increase substrate complexity and ASPs
Capacity expansion investments yield returns from FY2026
risk_factors: Intel market share losses reducing substrate demand
Capacity expansion execution risk and capital intensity
Competition from Korean and Taiwanese substrate makers

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 18x FY26E EPS on AI substrate supercycle

valuation_scenarios.label: Bear
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 12x FY25E EPS on Intel share loss

profile_json.valuation_notes: Ibiden's substrate business is undervalued relative to the AI packaging opportunity. Key risk is customer concentration with Intel but diversification toward other chipmakers is underway.

focus: Track AI accelerator substrate demand and FC-BGA order trends
Monitor Intel foundry progress and substrate diversification efforts
Watch advanced packaging technology roadmap (chiplets, 2.5D/3D)

profile_json.overview: Shinko Electric Industries is a leading semiconductor packaging substrate manufacturer, producing FC-BGA substrates and lead frames. A subsidiary of Fujitsu, the company is a key supplier for advanced processor packaging.
profile_json.thesis: Shinko benefits from the same AI/HPC substrate tailwind as Ibiden. FC-BGA demand for AI accelerators is outstripping supply. The company's capacity expansion should drive revenue growth acceleration from FY2026.
key_assumptions: FC-BGA substrate demand exceeds supply through 2027
Capacity expansion program on track for FY2026 contribution
Customer diversification beyond Fujitsu progresses
risk_factors: Capacity expansion delays or cost overruns
Substrate pricing pressure as new capacity comes online industry-wide
Fujitsu parent company strategic decisions

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 11x FY26E EPS on substrate demand surge

profile_json.valuation_notes: Shinko trades at a deep value multiple for an AI substrate beneficiary. The Fujitsu parent discount may persist but fundamental upside is compelling.

focus: Track FC-BGA capacity expansion progress and timeline
Monitor substrate supply-demand dynamics and pricing
Watch Fujitsu parent company strategic plans for Shinko

companies.name: Rohm Semiconductor
companies.sector: Semiconductors — Power Devices, SiC, Analog ICs

profile_json.overview: Rohm is a Japanese semiconductor company specializing in silicon carbide (SiC) power devices, analog ICs, and discrete components. The company is a leading SiC supplier for automotive EV applications, competing with STMicro and Infineon.
profile_json.thesis: Rohm's SiC power device business is positioned to benefit from EV adoption driving demand for efficient power management. However, SiC industry overcapacity concerns and slower EV adoption in some markets create near-term uncertainty.
key_assumptions: SiC adoption in EV powertrains continues to grow despite near-term deceleration
Joint ventures with Toshiba improve cost competitiveness
Analog IC demand stabilizes with industrial recovery
risk_factors: SiC overcapacity driving pricing pressure
Slower-than-expected EV adoption in key markets
Competition from STMicro, Infineon, and Chinese SiC entrants

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 15x FY26E EPS on SiC demand surge

profile_json.valuation_notes: Rohm is attractively valued on a P/B basis but faces SiC industry headwinds. Long-term EV adoption thesis is intact but near-term visibility is limited.

focus: Track SiC power device orders and pricing trends
Monitor EV production volumes and powertrain design wins
Watch SiC industry capacity additions and competitive dynamics

profile_json.overview: Socionext is a fabless semiconductor company specializing in custom SoC (System-on-Chip) design for automotive, data center, and networking applications. Spun off from Fujitsu and Panasonic in 2022, the company designs at advanced nodes (5nm, 3nm) using TSMC foundry.
profile_json.thesis: Socionext is uniquely positioned as one of few Japanese fabless chip designers with advanced node capability. Custom SoC demand for AI inference, automotive ADAS, and edge computing is accelerating. The company's design expertise at 5nm/3nm creates high barriers to entry.
key_assumptions: Custom SoC design wins in automotive and data center ramp into production
3nm design capability attracts new tier-1 customers
Fabless model enables operating margin expansion
risk_factors: Customer concentration risk in key design projects
TSMC foundry capacity allocation and pricing
Competition from Broadcom, Marvell in custom silicon

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 20x FY26E EPS on custom SoC wins

valuation_scenarios.label: Bear
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 12x FY25E EPS on design win delays

profile_json.valuation_notes: Socionext is a rare Japanese fabless play with strong IP and advanced node access. Valuation is reasonable given the growth trajectory.

focus: Track custom SoC design win announcements and production ramps
Monitor TSMC advanced node allocation and pricing for Socionext
Watch automotive ADAS and data center custom silicon demand trends

profile_json.overview: Kokusai Electric is a semiconductor equipment maker specializing in batch CVD and ALD (atomic layer deposition) systems for memory and logic chip production. Re-listed on TSE in 2023 after being acquired from Hitachi by KKR.
profile_json.thesis: Kokusai Electric is a key beneficiary of advanced memory (HBM, 3D NAND) and logic chip production requiring more deposition steps. The company's batch processing technology is essential for high-volume manufacturing efficiency.
key_assumptions: HBM and 3D NAND layer stacking drives deposition equipment demand
Logic chip node shrinks increase ALD process steps
Service revenue grows as installed base expands
risk_factors: Memory capex cyclicality impacting order timing
China export restrictions limiting addressable market
Competition from Applied Materials and Lam Research

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 16x FY26E EPS on memory capex recovery

profile_json.valuation_notes: Kokusai Electric is attractively valued relative to global semi equipment peers. HBM demand provides a structural growth catalyst beyond normal memory cycles.

focus: Track memory capex announcements from Samsung, SK Hynix, Micron
Monitor HBM production expansion and deposition tool demand
Watch China export restriction developments and impact on orders

companies.name: Tokyo Seimitsu
companies.sector: Semiconductor Equipment — Wafer Probing, Dicing, Metrology

profile_json.overview: Tokyo Seimitsu (Accretech) is a leading semiconductor equipment maker specializing in wafer probing, dicing, grinding, and precision metrology systems. The company serves both front-end and back-end semiconductor manufacturing processes.
profile_json.thesis: Tokyo Seimitsu benefits from advanced packaging trends driving demand for precision dicing and probing equipment. HBM and chiplet-based designs require more precise wafer-level processing, expanding the company's addressable market.
key_assumptions: Advanced packaging demand drives dicing/probing equipment growth
Metrology equipment demand rises with tighter process tolerances
Service revenue expands with growing installed base
risk_factors: Semi capex cyclicality impacting equipment orders
Competition from Disco and KLA in overlapping segments
China trade restriction impacts on equipment shipments

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 12x FY26E EPS on packaging equipment upcycle

profile_json.valuation_notes: Tokyo Seimitsu trades at an attractive discount to global semi equipment peers despite strong advanced packaging exposure.

focus: Track advanced packaging equipment order trends
Monitor semiconductor capex cycle indicators
Watch dicing/probing technology developments for HBM and chiplets

companies.name: Hamamatsu Photonics
companies.sector: Photonics — Optical Sensors, Light Sources, Imaging

profile_json.overview: Hamamatsu Photonics is a world-leading manufacturer of optical sensors, photodetectors, light sources, and imaging systems. The company serves diverse end markets including medical diagnostics, scientific instruments, industrial inspection, and semiconductor manufacturing.
profile_json.thesis: Hamamatsu has a unique niche in photonics technology with strong market positions and high margins. However, growth is modest and tied to macro-sensitive end markets. AI-related demand for optical inspection could provide upside optionality.
key_assumptions: Medical and scientific instrument demand remains stable
Semiconductor inspection drives photonics demand growth
New applications in quantum computing and LiDAR emerge
risk_factors: Slow growth in traditional medical/scientific end markets
Yen appreciation impacting export competitiveness
Limited near-term AI demand catalysts

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 25x FY26E EPS on new application wins

profile_json.valuation_notes: Hamamatsu is a quality compounder but currently fully valued. Best approached on pullbacks or with catalyst from new application adoption.

focus: Track semiconductor inspection and medical imaging demand
Monitor new application development in quantum and LiDAR
Watch yen trends impacting export competitiveness

companies.name: Fujitsu
companies.sector: IT Services — Enterprise Solutions, Cloud, Digital Transformation

profile_json.overview: Fujitsu is Japan's largest IT services company, providing enterprise solutions, cloud computing, managed services, and digital transformation consulting. The company has been pivoting from hardware toward higher-margin IT services and software.
profile_json.thesis: Fujitsu's transformation from a hardware-centric conglomerate to an IT services company is progressing. Enterprise digital transformation demand supports steady growth, but margins lag global IT services peers. AI integration into enterprise services could accelerate growth.
key_assumptions: Enterprise DX spending in Japan continues at mid-single-digit growth
Services margin expansion continues through portfolio restructuring
AI services and Fujitsu Uvance platform gain traction
risk_factors: Slower-than-expected margin expansion in services
Competition from Accenture, NTT Data in Japan IT services
Legacy hardware business drag on overall profitability

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 24x FY26E EPS on AI services uptake

profile_json.valuation_notes: Fujitsu is making progress on its services transformation but valuation already reflects moderate improvement. Upside depends on AI services and margin acceleration.

focus: Track Fujitsu Uvance platform adoption and AI services pipeline
Monitor IT services margin trends and portfolio restructuring
Watch Japan enterprise DX spending indicators

companies.name: NEC Corporation
companies.sector: IT Services — Telecom, Public Safety, Enterprise IT

profile_json.overview: NEC Corporation is a major Japanese IT and telecom company providing network infrastructure (5G/Open RAN), biometric security (facial recognition), enterprise IT services, and public sector solutions. The company is a global leader in Open RAN technology.
profile_json.thesis: NEC's Open RAN leadership positions it to benefit from telecom network disaggregation globally. However, overall growth remains subdued and the company is still executing a turnaround. Biometric security business is a niche but growing segment.
key_assumptions: Open RAN adoption accelerates with global 5G rollout
Public sector IT modernization in Japan drives stable demand
Biometric security wins expand in airports and public safety
risk_factors: Open RAN adoption slower than expected
Japan government IT spending cuts impacting public sector business
Persistent margin pressure in legacy telecom equipment

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 25x FY26E EPS on Open RAN acceleration

profile_json.valuation_notes: NEC is fairly valued with Open RAN optionality providing upside. Execution on the structural transformation needs to improve for re-rating.

focus: Track Open RAN deployment wins and global adoption metrics
Monitor biometric security contract wins and pipeline
Watch Japan public sector IT spending and modernization initiatives

companies.name: SoftBank Group
companies.name_jp: ソフトバンクグループ

profile_json.overview: SoftBank Group is a global technology investment holding company with major stakes in Arm Holdings, Vision Fund portfolio companies, and other tech ventures. The company is pivoting toward AI-focused investments under Masayoshi Son's vision.
profile_json.thesis: SoftBank Group's Arm Holdings stake is the crown jewel, benefiting from AI chip architecture demand. The Vision Fund portfolio recovery and new AI investments could drive significant NAV expansion. However, the holding company discount remains wide.
key_assumptions: Arm Holdings continues to benefit from AI chip licensing growth
Vision Fund portfolio companies recover and generate exits
New AI investments (e.g., Stargate project) create long-term value
risk_factors: Wide and persistent holding company discount to NAV
Vision Fund investment losses in a tech downturn
Masayoshi Son risk and governance concerns
High leverage at the holding company level

valuation_scenarios.label: Bear

profile_json.valuation_notes: SoftBank Group is essentially a leveraged bet on Arm and AI investments. NAV discount could narrow with improved capital allocation discipline.

Monitor Vision Fund portfolio performance and exits

profile_json.overview: Nikon is a precision optics company with operations in semiconductor lithography equipment, FPD lithography, precision instruments, and imaging products (cameras). The lithography business competes with ASML and Canon in the semiconductor equipment market.
profile_json.thesis: Nikon faces structural challenges as ASML dominates advanced EUV lithography while Nikon remains in the ArF immersion segment with limited growth prospects. The imaging business is in secular decline. Nikon's best opportunity is in the growing FPD and precision instruments segments.
key_assumptions: ArF immersion lithography demand stabilizes with mature node fabs
Precision instruments and healthcare optics provide modest growth
Camera market continues secular decline but at a slower rate
risk_factors: ASML dominance pushing Nikon further out of advanced lithography
Continued camera market decline eroding imaging profits
Chinese fab buildout for mature nodes is Nikon's key market — geopolitical risk

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 14x FY26E EPS on precision instruments growth

valuation_scenarios.label: Bear
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 8x FY25E EPS on litho share loss

profile_json.valuation_notes: Nikon trades below book value reflecting structural challenges. Limited catalysts for re-rating without a strategic pivot away from declining lithography and imaging.

focus: Track ArF immersion lithography orders and China fab demand
Monitor precision instruments and healthcare optics growth
Watch strategic restructuring and portfolio optimization plans

profile_json.overview: SUMCO is the world's second-largest silicon wafer manufacturer after Shin-Etsu Chemical, producing 300mm and 200mm silicon wafers for semiconductor fabrication. The company serves all major foundries and IDMs globally.
profile_json.thesis: SUMCO faces near-term headwinds from silicon wafer oversupply and pricing pressure as memory chip makers reduce wafer purchases. Long-term wafer demand is supported by AI/data center buildout but near-term earnings visibility is poor.
key_assumptions: Wafer demand recovers with memory capex recovery in 2H2026
300mm wafer pricing stabilizes after contract renegotiations
Advanced wafer demand for leading-edge logic provides growth
risk_factors: Prolonged wafer oversupply and pricing pressure
Memory capex downturn deeper than expected
Competition from Shin-Etsu and SK Siltron

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 15x FY26E EPS on wafer demand recovery

profile_json.valuation_notes: SUMCO is in a cyclical trough but valuation does not yet reflect earnings decline. Wait for clearer wafer demand recovery signals before entry.

focus: Track silicon wafer pricing and long-term agreement renegotiations
Monitor memory fab utilization and wafer demand indicators
Watch 300mm wafer supply-demand balance and inventory levels

companies.name: Rakuten Group
companies.sector: Internet & Mobile — E-commerce, Fintech, Mobile Network

profile_json.overview: Rakuten Group is Japan's largest e-commerce platform operator, with additional businesses in fintech (Rakuten Card, Rakuten Bank), mobile network (Rakuten Mobile), and digital content. The mobile network build-out has been a major cash drain.
profile_json.thesis: Rakuten faces severe financial stress from the mobile network capex burden with profitability elusive. While e-commerce and fintech are solid businesses, massive mobile losses continue to destroy value. Balance sheet leverage is concerning.
key_assumptions: Rakuten Mobile ARPU and subscriber growth gradually improve
E-commerce ecosystem maintains market position vs. Amazon Japan
Fintech segment (Rakuten Card, Bank) provides stable cash flows
risk_factors: Rakuten Mobile continues burning cash with no path to profitability
Balance sheet leverage reaching unsustainable levels
Amazon Japan gaining market share in e-commerce
Need for further equity dilution or asset sales

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: SOTP if mobile reaches breakeven by 2027

profile_json.valuation_notes: Rakuten is a value trap. The mobile network business continues to destroy value and the path to group profitability remains uncertain. Avoid until mobile losses narrow materially.

focus: Track Rakuten Mobile subscriber growth and ARPU trends
Monitor balance sheet leverage and funding needs
Watch e-commerce market share vs. Amazon Japan

profile_json.overview: LY Corporation (formerly Z Holdings/LINE Yahoo) is Japan's largest internet company, operating Yahoo! Japan search/portal, LINE messaging app, e-commerce (Yahoo Shopping, PayPay Mall), and fintech (PayPay). Majority owned by SoftBank Group.
profile_json.thesis: LY Corp has a dominant position in Japan's internet ecosystem but monetization lags global peers. PayPay fintech integration is a key growth driver but regulatory scrutiny and data governance issues have created overhang. AI integration could improve monetization.
key_assumptions: PayPay ecosystem drives fintech revenue growth
AI-powered search and advertising improves monetization
LINE messaging engagement remains stable in Japan/Taiwan/Thailand
risk_factors: Government data governance scrutiny following Naver data breach
Competition from Google in search and advertising
Slow monetization of LINE's large user base
profile_json.valuation_notes: LY Corp is fairly valued but data governance overhang persists. PayPay fintech integration is the most compelling growth vector.

focus: Track PayPay transaction volume and fintech revenue growth
Monitor Japan government data governance requirements
Watch AI integration in Yahoo Japan search and advertising

profile_json.overview: SoftBank Corp is Japan's third-largest mobile carrier (after NTT Docomo and KDDI), providing mobile, broadband, and enterprise IT services. A subsidiary of SoftBank Group, the company is investing in AI and enterprise digital transformation.
profile_json.thesis: SoftBank Corp offers a stable telecom dividend with modest growth from enterprise IT and AI services. The ARPU environment in Japan is stable and the company is investing in AI-powered enterprise solutions. Defensive positioning with AI optionality.

Enterprise segment grows with AI and cloud services
Dividend payout remains sustainable and grows modestly

Monitor enterprise AI services revenue growth
Watch dividend policy and payout sustainability

companies.name: Samsung SDI
companies.sector: EV Batteries — Lithium-ion Cells, Energy Storage

profile_json.thesis: Samsung SDI benefits from EV adoption growth but faces intensifying competition from CATL and LG Energy Solution. The company's solid-state battery roadmap and partnership with Stellantis for US production provide medium-term catalysts.

Stellantis JV factory ramp in US contributes from 2026
Solid-state battery pilot production achieves milestones

valuation_scenarios.methodology: 22x FY26E EPS on EV demand acceleration

profile_json.valuation_notes: Samsung SDI is fairly valued relative to peers. Upside depends on Stellantis JV ramp and solid-state battery progress.

focus: Track EV battery cell orders and Stellantis JV ramp progress
Monitor solid-state battery development milestones
Watch CATL pricing actions and industry margin trends

companies.name: LG Energy Solution
companies.sector: EV Batteries — Lithium-ion Cells, Energy Storage

profile_json.overview: LG Energy Solution is the world's second-largest EV battery manufacturer after CATL, supplying pouch and cylindrical cells to Tesla, GM, Hyundai, and other major automakers. The company has US manufacturing JVs with GM (Ultium Cells) and Honda.
profile_json.thesis: LG Energy Solution is well-positioned for EV growth with diversified customer base and US manufacturing presence benefiting from IRA subsidies. However, near-term margins are pressured by overcapacity and raw material cost fluctuations.

profile_json.overview: Naver is South Korea's dominant search engine and internet platform, with businesses spanning search/advertising, e-commerce (Smart Store), cloud computing, fintech (Naver Pay), and content (Webtoon). The company also holds a significant stake in LY Corporation (Japan).
profile_json.thesis: Naver's search dominance in Korea provides a stable cash flow base while e-commerce, cloud, and AI investments drive growth. The HyperCLOVA AI integration across the platform should improve monetization. Webtoon global expansion provides optionality.
key_assumptions: Search advertising ARPU improves with AI-powered targeting
E-commerce Smart Store continues gaining share in Korea
Cloud and enterprise AI solutions adoption accelerates

E-commerce competition from Coupang and SSG.COM

focus: Track HyperCLOVA AI integration and search monetization metrics
Monitor e-commerce Smart Store transaction volume growth

profile_json.overview: Kakao is a major Korean internet conglomerate operating KakaoTalk messaging, Kakao Entertainment (webtoons, music), Kakao Mobility (ride-hailing), Kakao Pay (fintech), and Kakao Games. The company has faced regulatory scrutiny and governance issues.
profile_json.thesis: Kakao's dominant KakaoTalk messaging platform gives it unmatched reach in Korea, but regulatory crackdown, governance concerns, and poor subsidiary monetization weigh on the stock. The company needs to demonstrate improved capital allocation and corporate governance.

Watch subsidiary restructuring and capital allocation decisions

IC substrate business benefits from advanced packaging trends

key_assumptions: Customer logo growth and seat expansion sustain revenue growth
Adjacent product modules expand wallet share per customer
AI supply chain optimization features drive premium pricing
risk_factors: Premium valuation leaves no room for execution missteps
Global trade slowdown impacting logistics volumes
Competition from SAP and Oracle in supply chain software

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 136x FY26E EPS on logistics platform dominance

profile_json.valuation_notes: WiseTech commands an extreme premium but best-in-class logistics platform with high switching costs supports it. Conviction buyers only.

focus: Track CargoWise customer logo growth and revenue per customer
Monitor logistics industry digitization trends globally
Watch AI supply chain optimization product development

profile_json.overview: Technology One is an Australian enterprise software company providing SaaS solutions for government, education, health, and corporate sectors. The company's ERP platform serves over 1,200 customers primarily in Australia, New Zealand, and the UK.
profile_json.thesis: Technology One is a defensive SaaS compounder with high customer retention and growing recurring revenue. The UK market expansion provides a long growth runway. Government and education customers provide recession-resistant revenue streams.
key_assumptions: SaaS annual recurring revenue grows at 15%+ annually
UK market expansion gains traction with new wins
Government and education customers maintain high retention
risk_factors: UK market penetration slower than expected
Competition from SAP and Oracle in mid-market ERP
Premium valuation sensitive to growth deceleration
profile_json.valuation_notes: Technology One is a high-quality defensive SaaS play with government/education customer base. Premium valuation reflects consistency.

focus: Track SaaS ARR growth and customer retention metrics
Monitor UK market expansion progress and new customer wins
Watch government and education IT spending trends

companies.name: Pro Medicus
companies.sector: Health Tech — Medical Imaging, Radiology AI

The company has been winning major US health system contracts and is considered a best-in-class medical imaging platform.
profile_json.thesis: Pro Medicus is winning large multi-year contracts with major US health systems, replacing legacy PACS (picture archiving) systems. The Visage platform's speed, AI integration, and cloud architecture provide strong competitive advantages. Contract runway provides multi-year earnings visibility.

AI diagnostic features expand addressable market
Contract ramp provides 25%+ revenue growth through 2027

profile_json.overview: NextDC is Australia's largest independent data center operator, providing colocation and connectivity services across major Australian cities. The company operates tier-3 and tier-4 data centers serving hyperscalers, enterprise, and government customers.
profile_json.thesis: NextDC is the prime beneficiary of AI-driven data center demand in Australia. The company's expansion pipeline includes significant new capacity across Australian markets. Hyperscaler demand for Australian data center space is accelerating with AI workload growth.
key_assumptions: Hyperscaler AI workload demand drives data center capacity absorption
New data center developments ramp on schedule
Pricing power improves as supply-demand tightens in Australia
risk_factors: Capital intensive expansion requiring ongoing funding
Power availability and pricing in Australian markets
Competition from global data center operators entering Australia

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 35x FY26E EBITDA on AI demand surge

profile_json.valuation_notes: NextDC is Australia's best AI infrastructure play with significant expansion pipeline. Capital intensity is the key risk but demand visibility is strong.

focus: Track data center capacity utilization and new customer contracts
Monitor hyperscaler demand for Australian data center space
Watch power availability and pricing for new developments

companies.name: REA Group
companies.sector: Internet — Real Estate Listings, Property Technology

profile_json.overview: REA Group is Australia's dominant online real estate platform (realestate.com.au), providing property listings, agent services, financial services (mortgage broking), and data analytics. The company has a near-monopoly position in Australian online real estate.
profile_json.thesis: REA Group's dominant market position in Australian real estate provides strong pricing power and high margins. Rising listing volumes and premium product adoption drive revenue growth. AI-powered property valuation and search could expand monetization.
key_assumptions: Australian property listing volumes grow with housing market recovery
Depth product penetration and pricing increases drive ARPU growth
Financial services (mortgages) provides diversification
risk_factors: Australian housing market downturn reducing listings
Competition from Domain (Nine Entertainment)
Regulatory risk on real estate agent commissions
profile_json.valuation_notes: REA Group is a quality monopoly platform but premium valuation limits upside. Best bought on pullbacks during housing market weakness.

focus: Track Australian property listing volumes and market activity
Monitor depth product penetration and agent ARPU trends
Watch Australian housing market indicators (rates, approvals)

profile_json.overview: Seek is an Australian online employment marketplace operating in Australia/NZ, Asia (including China via Zhaopin), and Latin America. The company provides job listing platforms, HR technology, and data analytics for recruitment.
profile_json.thesis: Seek faces structural challenges from LinkedIn's growing dominance in professional recruitment and AI-powered recruitment tools disrupting traditional job listing platforms. The Asia and LatAm operations provide growth but margin dilution.
key_assumptions: Australian employment market remains resilient
AI-powered matching tools improve platform value proposition
Asia/LatAm operations reach profitability targets
risk_factors: LinkedIn competition eroding job listing platform demand
AI recruitment tools disrupting traditional marketplace model
Zhaopin (China) underperformance continues
profile_json.valuation_notes: Seek faces structural headwinds from LinkedIn and AI recruitment. Valuation premium is unjustified given growth challenges. Avoid.

focus: Track job listing volumes and advertiser trends in ANZ
Monitor LinkedIn competitive impact on recruitment platforms
Watch Zhaopin performance and China employment market

profile_json.overview: Sea Limited is a Southeast Asian internet conglomerate operating Shopee (leading SEA e-commerce platform), Garena (gaming - Free Fire), and SeaMoney (fintech/digital payments). Shopee also operates in Latin America and other markets.
profile_json.thesis: Sea Limited has successfully pivoted Shopee to profitability while maintaining market leadership in Southeast Asian e-commerce. Free Fire gaming provides stable cash flows. SeaMoney fintech expansion creates a new growth vector. SEA's growing digital economy provides a long runway.
key_assumptions: Shopee maintains e-commerce market leadership in SEA
E-commerce take rate and advertising revenue expand margins
SeaMoney financial services achieve profitability scale
risk_factors: Intensifying e-commerce competition from TikTok Shop and Lazada
Free Fire gaming revenue cyclicality
LatAm operations profitability remains uncertain

valuation_scenarios.label: Bull
valuation_scenarios.methodology: 50x FY26E EPS on SEA digital economy growth

profile_json.valuation_notes: Sea Limited is the best way to play Southeast Asia's digital economy growth. Shopee's profitability pivot de-risks the investment case.

focus: Track Shopee GMV growth and take rate expansion
Monitor Free Fire gaming engagement and revenue trends
Watch TikTok Shop competitive impact in Southeast Asian e-commerce

profile_json.overview: Grab Holdings is Southeast Asia's leading super-app, providing ride-hailing, food delivery, grocery delivery, and financial services (GrabPay, lending, insurance) across 8 countries. The company is the dominant mobility platform in the region.
profile_json.thesis: Grab's super-app ecosystem in Southeast Asia provides a long growth runway as the region's digital economy expands. The path to profitability is becoming clearer with improving unit economics. However, competition from GoTo and others limits pricing power.
key_assumptions: GMV growth of 15-20% as SEA digital economy expands
Unit economics continue improving toward sustainable profitability
Financial services revenue scales with user base
risk_factors: Persistent losses and extended path to profitability
Intense competition from GoTo, Foodpanda, and local players
Regulatory risk in multiple Southeast Asian markets

valuation_scenarios.label: Base
valuation_scenarios.methodology: Revenue multiple on path to profit

profile_json.valuation_notes: Grab is a long-term play on SEA's digital economy but profitability timeline is uncertain. Wait for consistent profitability before adding.

focus: Track GMV growth and unit economics improvement trends
Monitor path to profitability and loss reduction trajectory
Watch competitive dynamics in SEA mobility and delivery

profile_json.overview: Venture Corporation is a Singapore-based EMS (electronics manufacturing services) and technology products company. The company provides design, manufacturing, and supply chain services across networking, medical, industrial, and consumer segments.
profile_json.thesis: Venture Corp provides diversified EMS exposure with higher margins than typical contract manufacturers through its technology product design capabilities. However, growth is modest and the stock is best suited for income investors seeking Singapore-listed tech exposure.
key_assumptions: Networking and infrastructure demand recovers with data center buildout
Medical device manufacturing provides stable revenue
Dividend payout maintained at attractive levels
risk_factors: Cyclical demand fluctuations across diverse end markets
Limited growth catalysts in mature EMS business
Competition from larger EMS providers

focus: Track networking and infrastructure product demand
Monitor medical device manufacturing revenue growth
Watch dividend sustainability and payout ratio
